Constructor Detail

Effect

public Effect()
Method Detail

getEffectType

protected abstract Effect.EffectType getEffectType()
Get the type of this effect, one of UNDER,BLENDED,OVER. UNDER means the result of apply effect should be painted under the src image. BLENDED means the result of apply sffect contains a modified src image so just it should be painted. OVER means the result of apply effect should be painted over the src image.

Returns:
The effect type

getOpacity

protected abstract float getOpacity()
Get the opacity to use to paint the result effected image if the EffectType is UNDER or OVER.

Returns:
The opactity for the effect, 0.0f -> 1.0f

applyEffect

public abstract BufferedImage applyEffect(BufferedImage src,
                                          BufferedImage dst,
                                          int w,
                                          int h)
Apply the effect to the src image generating the result . The result image may or may not contain the source image depending on what the effect type is.

Parameters:
src - The source image for applying the effect to
dst - The dstination image to paint effect result into. If this is null then a new image will be created
w - The width of the src image to apply effect to, this allow the src and dst buffers to be bigger than the area the need effect applied to it
h - The height of the src image to apply effect to, this allow the src and dst buffers to be bigger than the area the need effect applied to it
Returns:
The result of appl

fill

public void fill(Graphics2D g,
                 Shape s)
Paint the effect based around a solid shape in the graphics supplied.

Parameters:
g - the graphics to paint into.
s - the shape to base the effect around.

getArrayCache

protected static Effect.ArrayCache getArrayCache()
================================================================================================================= Static data cache

Returns:
the array cache.

createBufferedImage

protected static BufferedImage createBufferedImage(int width,
                                                   int height,
                                                   boolean hasAlpha)
Create a buffered image of the given width and height, compatible with the alpha requirement.

Parameters:
width - the width of the new buffered image.
height - the height of the new buffered image.
hasAlpha - true if the new buffered image needs to support alpha transparency, false otherwise.
Returns:
the newly created buffered image.

toBufferedImage

protected static BufferedImage toBufferedImage(Image image)
This method returns a buffered image with the contents of an image

Parameters:
image - the image to copy into a buffered image.
Returns:
the buffered image containing the image.
